CheckType: Software and Configuration Checks/AWS Security Best Practices
Software and Configuration Checks/Industry and Regulatory Standards/AWS Foundational Security Best Practices
Description: **EBS snapshots** with **public sharing** permissions (accessible by all AWS accounts) are identified, as opposed to snapshots shared privately with specific accounts.
Risk: Public snapshots expose full volume contents, harming **confidentiality**. Any account can create a volume from the snapshot to read files, secrets, or database data, enabling **data exfiltration**, broad reconnaissance, and facilitating **lateral movement**.

Code.CLI: aws ec2 modify-snapshot-attribute --snapshot-id <EC2_SNAPSHOT_ID> --attribute createVolumePermission --operation-type remove --group-names all
Code.Other:
1. Open the AWS Management Console and go to EC2
2. In the left menu, select Snapshots
3. Select the snapshot <EC2_SNAPSHOT_ID>
4. Click Actions > Modify permissions
5. Choose Private (remove Public/all if present)
6. Click Save changes

Recommendation.Text: Keep snapshots **private** and share only with specific accounts under **least privilege**. Enable `Block public access for Amazon EBS snapshots` regionally. Prefer **CMEK encryption** and avoid sharing keys broadly. Regularly review sharing permissions and monitor snapshot usage.
